result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Defendant Hope Amanda Miller appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Tyler William Wickman appeared by video for Hope Amanda Miller.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF11, 21CF150, 22CF133, and 22CF137.  Atty Wickman represents in 21CF11 and in remaining cases Atty Thompson represents.  21CF11 and 21CF150 are post arraignment here for STC. 
22CF133 and 22CF137 here for initial appearance.  Atty Thompson, waives reading of complaints, keep right to prelim hearing, waives time limits.  Def waives time limits.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is accepts waiver.  
22CF150 tracks
Atty Wickman would like to track 21CF11.  
Motion to modify bail.  Atty comments on motion.  State comments on motion.  Court denies motion.
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Def is set up to appear by zoom for court on Oct 10 from Oneida;  ka
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:18 PM Defendant Hope Amanda Miller appeared by phone, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Tyler William Wickman appeared by video for Hope Amanda Miller.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF11, 21CF150, 22CF133, and 22CF137.   Atty Wickman in case 21CF11 and Atty Thompson in other cases.  22CF133 and 22CF137 are initial appearances.  Atty asking for AIA to go over complaints.  Atty asking to track Atty Thompson agrees.  State does not object.  22CF133 and 22CF137 for AIA and others are STC.   If def is at liberty she needs to appear in person.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Hope Amanda Miller
Current: 711 1/2 3rd street, Ashland, WI 54806 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: PO BOX 224 75909 Alder St., Odanah, WI 54861

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ A.S. or residence, NO contact w/ A.M. not to be within one block of residence.

11:30 AM Defendant Hope Amanda Miller in court.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  In addition to this case there are three pending cases.  Cases 22CF133, 21CF150, and 21CF11 all in warrant status.  In 22CF133 not represented has attorneys in cases 21CF150 and 21CF11.  Complaint given to def from 22CF133 and 22CF137.  Def asking to set bond now.  State comments in 21CF150 no victim rights issue, request in 22CF137, notice was sent.  21CF11 FTA in April, 21CF150 FTA in July trail in this case, 22CF133 case issued with warrant.  Warrants in all three cases quashed.  711 1/2 3rd street East, Ashland.  State comments bail/bond.  Def comments on bail/bond.  Court orders cash bail $4000 with NC of A.S. or residence and A.M. and not to be within one city block of residence.  
22CF137 aia and 22CF133 aia and 21CF11 and 21CF150 STC.  Needs to make in person appearances from now on.
